title: Patriotism: More Unum, Less Pluribus Please
text: I am disappointed that Adam Kirsch’s otherwise fine essay “American Patriotism Is Worth Fighting For” (Review, Oct. 19) fails to mention a new campaign to promote healthy patriotism, the Patriotic Movement, or to cite “Reclaiming Patriotism,” the new book by the movement’s leader, Amitai Etzioni. The laudable goals of this movement are to build up the national community and its institutions, thereby reducing polarization and facilitating cooperative action on major problems. To achieve these goals it advocates a year of national service, teaching civics in all schools, enlisting volunteers to teach English to new immigrants...
description: Two factors contribute to waning patriotism: a general lack of education at all levels in American civics, history and culture, and that there are fewer of us who have served either in the military or performed public service.
